p: All sites show significant ( p < 0.05) warming trends in simulated summer river water temperatures (July to September) for 1950–2015 (Fig. 2) except NFF, SGN and HHY. The summer trend of 1.56 °C (66 yr) −1 is significantly ( p < 0.05) highest at FTC (Supplementary Table S5). Most of the sites show significantly ( p < 0.05) higher warming trends in August with the highest values at SFJ (1.68 °C (66 yr) −1), FSY (1.69 °C (66 yr) −1), CAC (1.75 °C (66 yr) −1) and FTC (1.80 °C (66 yr) −1) (Supplementary Table S5). The interannual variability of summer water temperature ranges between 0.37 °C to 0.88 °C across the FRB where the regulated sites in the Nechako River (NCF, NVH and NIP) lie in the bottom 50% of interannual variability (Supplementary Table S6). The signal to noise ratio exceeds unity for the sites with significant warming trends during summer suggesting this secular pattern dominates the interannual variation.
